title: TikTok tells Republican senators how it plans to keep American data away from China.
summary: “We know we are among the most scrutinized platforms from a security standpoint,” the video app’s chief executive wrote.

title: Google Says It Will Delete Location Data When Users Visit Abortion Clinics
summary: Under pressure from employees and supporters of reproductive rights, the company announced privacy changes for the post-Roe era.

title: When Where You Work Determines if You Can Get an Abortion
summary: After the Dobbs v. Jackson decision, many women are discovering that their employer can shape major decisions in their lives even more than it did a week ago.

title: 3-D Printing Grows Beyond Its Novelty Roots
summary: With the technology improving and costs falling, 3-D printing could be poised to play a major role in manufacturing.

title: Twitter, Challenging Orders to Remove Content, Sues India’s Government
summary: Twitter’s lawsuit is part of a broadening battle between the biggest tech companies and governments around the world over who gets to control information and how.

title: Lawmakers ask F.T.C. chair to investigate TikTok’s data practices.
summary: Questions are surfacing once again about whether TikTok poses a national security threat because it is owned by a Chinese company.

title: A Darkened Outlook for Britain
summary: The political instability comes as Britain gears up for a difficult summer, amid surging energy prices and labor shortages.

title: The Latin of Software Code Is Thriving
summary: Next time you laugh at musty old tech, remember that new technologies are often built on it.

title: Steam Deck Review: A Game Console for the Quintessential Gamer
summary: This new hand-held gaming device by Valve is lots of fun. But perhaps not as much if you’re a casual gamer.

summary: In a game called GeoGuessr, competitors try to pinpoint where in the world a Google Street View image has been taken. Some can do it in seconds.

summary: The number of users has plummeted, and its stock price has dropped. Former employees point to an emphasis on short-term growth over customer service.

summary: And yet, we demand that it protect us.

title: Even in Death, Internet Explorer Lives On in South Korea
summary: Why a country known for blazing broadband and innovative devices remains tethered to a browser that most of the world abandoned long ago.

summary: Makers of batteries that could charge in a few minutes are setting up assembly lines, bringing the technology a big step closer to auto showrooms.

summary: The sheer amount of tech tools and knowledge required to discreetly seek an abortion underlines how wide open we are to surveillance.

title: Online Shopping Is Bananas Confusing
summary: How much we buy online affects the whole economy, but right now there are lots of question marks.

title: Netflix turns to Microsoft to help build its new ad-supported service.
summary: The streaming giant hopes a less expensive offering will boost subscription numbers, which have dropped for the first time in a decade.

title: Amazon Moves to End a Long-Running Antitrust Case in Europe
summary: The retail giant said it would stop collecting nonpublic data on rivals and give merchants more ways to reach customers.

summary: Under pressure as tight oil supplies hurt the U.S. economy, Biden will go to Saudi Arabia for a meeting with M.B.S.

summary: Our readers tell us about the surprising ways in which tech has helped them discover new worlds.

title: Stock Market Drop Accelerated as Recession Seemed More Likely
summary: Further losses may be on the way, even after a 20 percent drop in the first half of the year, as Wall Street continues to price in the Fed’s aggressive interest rate policy.

summary: Elevian is one of several companies searching for ways to increase life span — in this case, using a protein called GDF11. But challenges lie ahead.

summary: A tech entrepreneur turned academic takes on the “disruption myth.” Big companies, he argues, have built software moats against rivals.

summary: The $3.9 billion deal is Amazon’s latest acquisition in the health care industry. In 2018, it acquired PillPack, an online pharmacy.

summary: Take roof trusses.

summary: The video service said it would take a closer look at the abortion content on its platform.

summary: Ukrainian technology companies have earned billions. But with most executives unable to meet foreign clients, the good times may not last.

title: Twitter’s earnings falter as it fights with Elon Musk.

summary: Amid rising inflation and the threat of recession, corporate earnings are coming under pressure.

summary: The engineer, Blake Lemoine, contends that the company’s language model has a soul. The company denies that and says he violated its security policies.

summary: Competing for rights to broadcast games from the N.F.L. and other leagues could be hard for broadcast and cable companies that “aren’t playing by the same financial rules.”

summary: Several signs of economic stress may keep the Fed from raising interest rates to a full percentage point.

summary: An escalation from Beijing would have far-reaching economic consequences.

summary: Facebook’s founder is setting a relentless pace as he pushes his company through a tech transformation during a global economic slowdown.

summary: The move is a potential blow to Meta’s metaverse efforts and signals a shift in how the Federal Trade Commission is approaching tech deals.

summary: Chair Jerome Powell was asked in every way possible whether the economy was in, or headed toward, a recession.
